pButton.Name: Volga
pButton.popInfo: The Volga River is the longest river in Europe and is important to Russia for shipping and transportation.

pButton.Name: Danube
pButton.popInfo: The Danube River is one of the most important rivers in Europe and today forms a part of the borders of 10 European countries. It originates in Germany and empties into the Black Sea.

pButton.Name: Loire
pButton.popInfo: The Loire River is France’s longest river, and provides water to the scenic Loire Valley, famous for its wine, cheese, and produce.

pButton.Name: Rhine
pButton.popInfo: The Rhine River originates in Switzerland and flows all the way to the North Sea, passing through many different countries. It is an important waterway for both tourism and commerce.

pButton.Name: Seine
pButton.popInfo: The Seine River is both a commercial waterway and an important tourist destination. It winds through France’s capital city of Paris.

pButton.Name: Thames
pButton.popInfo: The River Thames is located in England and became particularly important as London’s dominance in trade increased.
